**Please note that while we make every effort to clean this data, the speed and scale with which it was collected means that we cannot validate all of it. If you find an error in the data, please file an issue on this [Github page](https://github.com/saudiwin/corona_tscs/issues).**  

1. **CoronaNet Database Version 1.0 (core)**

This [file](https://github.com/saudiwin/corona_tscs/tree/master/data/CoronaNet/coronanet_release.csv) contains variables from the CoronaNet government response project, representing national and sub-national policy event data from more than 190 countries since January 1st, 2020. The data include source links, descriptions, targets (i.e. other countries), the type and level of enforcement, and a comprehensive set of policy types. For more detail on this data, you can see our [codebook here](data/codebook/CoronaNet_Codebook.pdf).  

```{r, include=FALSE, echo=FALSE}
# get newest dataset version from the main repository
# you still have to push the two files!
download.file("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/saudiwin/corona_tscs/master/data/CoronaNet/coronanet_release.csv", "./data/coronanet_release.csv")
download.file("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/saudiwin/corona_tscs/master/data/CoronaNet/coronanet_release.csv", "./docs/data/coronanet_release.csv")
```

</div>

2. **CoronaNet Database Version 1.0 (extended)**

This [file](https://github.com/saudiwin/corona_tscs/tree/master/data/CoronaNet/coronanet_release_allvars.csv) contains the government response information from the core data along with the following datasets:

  * Tests from the CoronaNet testing database (see http://coronanet-project.org for more info);
  * Cases/deaths/recovered from the JHU data repository (https://github.com/CSSEGISandData/COVID-19);
  * Country-level covariates including GDP, V-DEM democracy scores, human rights indices, power-sharing indices, and press freedom indices from the Niehaus World Economics and Politics Dataverse (https://niehaus.princeton.edu/news/world-economics-and-politics-dataverse)  

```{r, include=FALSE, echo=FALSE}
# get newest dataset version from the main repository
# you still have to push the two files!
download.file("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/saudiwin/corona_tscs/master/data/CoronaNet/coronanet_release_allvars.csv", "./data/coronanet_release_allvars.csv")
download.file("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/saudiwin/corona_tscs/master/data/CoronaNet/coronanet_release_allvars.csv", "./docs/data/coronanet_release_allvars.csv")
```

##  CoronaNet Learning Platform {-}

We are an open data science initiative. This means that we want to invite everyone to work with our data. For people who are not familiar with statistical programs, we have designed a Learning Platform that shows you how to work with our data via RStudio. 

Please follow this link to enter the [CoronaNet Learning Platform](https://lumesserschmidt.github.io/stats_CoronaNet/index.html)
